author: Farkas Gabor
comment: "see all compatible apps"? "Be up-to-date"? With this app? It hasn't been updated since last year! How could I be up-to-date if you never update your app and don't list the newest Wear apps in it? Android Wear 2.0 was just released a few weeks ago and it's the biggest hit, but you never took the time for making an update for the latest 2.0 apps that are appearing every single day. Your last Google+ post for Wear apps was made about 10 weeks ago. If you offer a paid service, you should take it much more seriously than this.

This app is great! I can easily find apps for my ZTE quartz smartwatch. If I could make a suggestion, please make it easier to find individual apps within a category.   If this feature has already been implemented, thank you very much and please disregard my suggestion.

author: Dean Lewis
comment: Can't believe Android Wear through the Play Store don't feature Stocard. A good place to browse, although while I like this app, I don't love it - visually there's work to do (I'm a graphic artist if you wanna chat 😉).
title: I found stocard through this app

comment: Funny how Google is TOO lazy to do this themselves

author: mike lawlor
comment: The app has multiple silly bugs. The back button on the top left sends you back to the main app screen which is really annoying. Also, many app preview images don't show up. Finally, it would be nice if all watch faces are removed from the apps categories. They should only be in the watch faces section.

reply.author: GoKo
reply.content:
Hello Mike,
thanks for the review.
In the upcoming update the watchfaces are removed from the apps categories and the bug with the preview images should also be fixed.

Best,
Jakob

title: Bugs

author: Michael Slansky
comment: Really like this app. However, I tried to sign up for the beta program. No matter what I tried to do, it just wouldn't allow me to update to the beta version. Really ridiculous that a professional app should act this way! I had to uninstall, and reinstall after the problem. Lost a 🌟 because of this frustrating problem!
title: Stupid problem!

author: jason jones
comment: I like the app and its better than searching the play store but watchfaces should not be in the new apps list, its misleading when it says there are 30 new apps and then you see they are all paid watch faces , I use watchmaker premium and facer and I would never pay the prices they ask for a watchface on the play store.
title: Too many watch faces in the "apps" section

author: Rick Michaels
comment: I tried out all the other e-mail clients for my smartwatch & this one is the  best one so far. Easy UI, easy to set up & configure all different kinds of e-mail accounts. I hope the developer keeps working in this e-mail app to make it even better!
title: THE BEST ONE YET!

comment: Won't show new apps, despite telling me how many new apps there are

reply.content:
Hello Carl,
the problem should be fixed now.

Best,
Jakob

title: New apps

author: Giovanni Chavez
comment: When your checking out an app or watch face and decide to go bac

reply.author: GoKo
reply.content:
Hello Giovanni,
the button on the top left isn't a back button. It's the home button and lead you directly back to the home screen.

For more information: https://developer.android.com/design/patterns/navigation.html

Best,
Jakob
